main event: On November 13, 1956, a civilian reported a sighting of one round blue object, the size of a ball, in Pound & Nekoosa, Wisconsin. The object hovered at times, ascended and descended below the horizon, and blinked off and on at intervals less than a second before disappearing after about one minute.
interesting points: The object was described as a round blue object, the size of a ball, and at times, it appeared smaller than the original size.
It hovered at times and blinked off and on at intervals less than a second.
The object ascended and descended below the horizon before disappearing after about one minute.
The conclusion of the report suggests that the object was probably a balloon.
The sighting lasted for a few seconds to one minute, and the object had features consistent with a tail ten times the size of the object.
sighted object: one round blue object, the size of a ball
